quiz.title: Variable Trap Inequalities
quiz.subtitle: Unit 6 Quiz 12: Advanced Inequality Solving with Tricky Variable Cancellation
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Inequalities Where Variables Cancel or Create Special Cases

questions.question: Solve: $x - \frac{2x - 1}{3} < \frac{x + 4}{2}$
questions.explanation: Multiply by 6: $6x - 2(2x - 1) < 3(x + 4)$. Expand: $6x - 4x + 2 < 3x + 12$. Simplify: $2x + 2 < 3x + 12$. Solve: $-10 < x$ or $x > -10$.

questions.question: Solve: $4(x - 2) - \frac{1}{2}(8x - 10) \geq 3x - 15$
questions.explanation: Expand: $4x - 8 - 4x + 5 \geq 3x - 15$. Notice $4x - 4x$ cancels! Left: $-3 \geq 3x - 15$. Add 15: $12 \geq 3x$. Divide: $4 \geq x$ or $x \leq 4$.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{2x}{3} - \frac{x+1}{4} + \frac{x-2}{6} \leq 2$
questions.explanation: Multiply by 12: $8x - 3(x+1) + 2(x-2) \leq 24$. Expand: $8x - 3x - 3 + 2x - 4 \leq 24$. Combine: $7x - 7 \leq 24$. Add 7: $7x \leq 31$. Divide: $x \leq \frac{31}{7}$.

questions.question: Solve: $20 - 5(x + \frac{4}{5}) \leq -2(2x + 6)$
questions.explanation: Expand: $20 - 5x - 4 \leq -4x - 12$. Combine: $16 - 5x \leq -4x - 12$. Add 5x: $16 \leq x - 12$. Add 12: $28 \leq x$ or $x \geq 28$.

questions.question: Solve: $3(\frac{x}{3} + 2) - x > 5$
questions.explanation: Expand: $x + 6 - x > 5$. Notice $x - x$ cancels completely! Left: $6 > 5$. This is ALWAYS true regardless of x. So All Real Numbers.

scoreMessages.90: Masterful! You handle tricky variable cancellation, identity cases, and complex fractional inequalities with precision.
scoreMessages.70: Excellent skills with challenging traps! Focus on: 1) Recognizing when variables cancel completely, 2) Careful expansion of nested expressions, 3) Checking for special cases.
scoreMessages.50: Good work with advanced problems. Key insights: 1) Variables may cancel leaving true/false statements, 2) Always simplify completely before deciding, 3) Watch for 'All Real Numbers' or 'No Solution' cases.
scoreMessages.0: Important: Simplify completely! If all variables cancel, check the remaining statement: True → All Real Numbers, False → No Solution. Otherwise, solve normally.
